comments:
Go to the Common tab for a Java program
Select "Other" for encoding

We should either present an error that the encoding is not set or pick the 
first one in the drop down by default.
otherwise on launch:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException: 
	at sun.io.Converters.getConverterClass(Converters.java:215)
	at sun.io.Converters.newConverter(Converters.java:248)
	at sun.io.ByteToCharConverter.getConverter(ByteToCharConverter.java:64)

	at org.eclipse.ui.console.IOConsoleOutputStream.write
(IOConsoleOutputStream.java:199)

mAppended(ProcessConsole.java:570)

fixed in CommonTab and LaunchConfigurationsMessages (.java & .properties).
selected the first in the list, and validated the selection in isValid() just in case there are no system 
encodings... not sure that would ever happen.
